Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Alexandria, Virginia, Phillip W. Smalley says illicit homosexual remarks as a joke and receives arrest warrant for solicitation and sodomy, potentially faces 5 years in prison2. Three United State Court of Appeals judges uphold Temple University discriminatory lower court ruling3. San Francisco gay man on trial for battery and resisting arrest, pleads not guilty4. South Carolina pornography lawsCOMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation5. Superior court judge voids ban on bathhouse sex6. Reagan Republican National Committee spends large sum for California GOP candidate7. Dr. Silverman, Former Head of San Francisco Public Health and Robin Williams hold press conference opposing proposition 64, includes coverage8. Metropolitan Church Committee wins right to hold religious services for prisoners9. Lesbian Caucus holds 2nd annual blood drive, to benefit AIDS patients10. Mishi Cohen, director of Quan Yin Acupuncture, discusses alternative medicine and AIDS research11. Sally Gearhart commentary12. AIDS Bills, AB3667, FB1327, AB31237, AB33233, and AB4249 13. Gay Father's Coalition changes name to The Gay and Lesbian Parents Association International14. AIDS victim Mark Siegel dies15. California Closing credits16. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Michael Shernoff discusses his Safer Sex Workshop17. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff BixbyCOMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazineCOMMERCIAL: Terry Miller, Different Life BookshopCOMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation2. Current events/media/culture, includes clipsCOMMERCIAL: Interart Theatre3. Cooking with Esther4. Closing credits
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 34 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. [Air Date: 9/9/1984]: September 1984
